intro: Pachyanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pachyanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
